image.altText: Grace Tame is wearing a black jacket and speaking

items.synopsis: The Northern Territory becomes the last jurisdiction in the country to remove the word "relationship" from child sexual abuse legislation, a move praised by advocate Grace Tame.

title.children: NT becomes last jurisdiction to remove 'relationship' from child abuse laws

image.altText: A photograph of Royal Darwin Hospital, with a large 'Emergency' arrow pointing to the main entrance.

items.synopsis: New laws in the Northern Territory will allow families and close friends to make healthcare decisions on behalf of individuals with impaired decision-making capacity.

title.children: New NT laws empower families to make healthcare decisions for relatives

image.altText: A white, modernist, flat-fronted building with "supreme court" in capital letters above a wide entrance.

items.synopsis: A Northern Territory father who groomed and sexually assaulted his wife's younger sisters will spend at least four years in prison, after pleading guilty to four charges.

title.children: NT father sentenced for grooming and assaulting pre-teen family members

image.altText: Dr Amanada White holding novelty-sized cheque

items.synopsis: A robot designed to pick mangoes and hopefully ease worker shortage issues, expected to "create ripples through the supply chain", has landed $1 million in venture capital.

title.children: Mango-picking robot snaps up $1 million in venture capital

image.altText: a young woman with brown hair kissing a dog

items.synopsis: A new aged care centre designed by Aboriginal elders of remote north-east Arnhem Land is being hailed as a game changer for care in the region.

title.children: 'Little Heaven': The remote Australian aged care centre where even a rescue dog can find home

image.altText: A young blonde girl smiles at the camera

items.synopsis: Tasmania Police have charged a 36-year-old man with the murder of teenager Shyanne-Lee Tatnell, after human remains were found in bushland in Tasmania's north-east

title.children: Tasmania Police charge man with murder of teenager Shyanne-Lee Tatnell

image.altText: Middle aged man close up of his face in a car, photographer in background

items.synopsis: Lawyers for Tim Mathieson, the former partner of Julia Gillard, say he will plead guilty to a charge of sexual assault during a hearing in the Melbourne Magistrates' Court.

title.children: Tim Mathieson, former partner of Julia Gillard, to plead guilty to sexual assault charge

image.altText: Education Minister Jason Clare in a classroom with students

items.synopsis: A report by a network of Indigenous leaders has made the case for a First Nations-led education system that prioritises language and culture for Aboriginal children.

title.children: Is it time to rethink the way First Nations children are educated?

image.altText: Woman with shaved head in floral dress sings into microphone

items.synopsis: From the moment she rocketed to international stardom with her rendition of Prince's Nothing Compares 2 U, Sinéad O'Connor attracted plenty of public attention.

title.children: Ripping the pope, torching Madonna: The many controversies of Sinéad O'Connor's career

image.altText: Black and white photo of building with two christian crosses on the roof with people on a car below in the driveway

items.synopsis: Justice Bernard Murphy has travelled through the Northern Territory this week as part of an ongoing class action over allegedly stolen wages of Aboriginal people before 1971.

title.children: Surviving the stolen generation and bombing of Darwin: Class action evidence heard in Federal Court

image.altText: Bald unsmiling older man sits at desk with heart model, computer, lavender shirt, stethoscope around his neck, diplomas on wall.

items.synopsis: Hermann Wittmer, 65, is one of the founding doctors of his region's only advanced cardiology unit. But he says red tape and a shortage of Australian-trained doctors is putting the service at risk.

title.children: This cardiologist should be planning his retirement, but he worries about his patients' future

image.altText: Greg Jenkins 1

items.synopsis: The Reserve Bank is hiking interest rates — and hitting borrowers — to fight high inflation, but data suggests the fight is being undermined by big-spending baby boomers.

title.children: 'We're not paying the price': The boomers boosting inflation as the RBA lifts rates to fight it

image.altText: A woman looks up at a large transmission tower.

items.synopsis: New figures from the Australian Energy Market Operator show wholesale power prices have fallen by nearly 60 per cent in the past year, while households brace for an increase of at least 20 per cent to their power bill.

title.children: Why are power bills rising while wholesale electricity prices are falling? It's because of 'a horrible coincidence'

image.altText: Chris Hipkins and Anthony Albanese standing at podiums at a press conference.

items.synopsis: Anthony Albanese insists Australia's ties with New Zealand will not suffer if there is a change of government in Wellington, as the man firming to replace incumbent Chris Hipkins talks up his relationship with Australia's prime minister.

title.children: As Albanese tours NZ with PM Hipkins, he takes a brief aside with nation's next possible leader

image.altText: A composite image of Kevin Spacey clutching an Oscar and a court sketch

items.synopsis: The trial against Kevin Spacey was a strange mix of celebrity witnesses, tearful testimony and graphic allegations of sexual violence. WARNING: Some readers may find details in this story distressing.

title.children: Kevin Spacey was one of the biggest names hit by #MeToo. Here's why a London court cleared him

image.altText: A composite image of Emmanuel Macron holding two clenched fists and Antony Blinken looking stoic

items.synopsis: The United States says "the door is open" for New Zealand to join AUKUS, as three of the world's most influential leaders continue their tour of the Pacific region.

title.children: Macron warns of 'new imperialism' in Pacific, as Blinken says 'door is open' for NZ to join AUKUS

image.altText: Young man stands facing away from camera wearing a hat

items.synopsis: A children's magistrate in Port Kembla has described this innovative mentoring program as "remarkable" and "transformative" for young people who were once on a bleak path. But its future is under threat.

title.children: This 'extraordinary' program halting domestic violence in its tracks is about to run out of money

image.altText: Image of couple in front of cancelled and sign and Metricon label

items.synopsis: Metricon, the biggest home builder in the country, has told some customers to pay painfully higher prices or risk losing their new homes and deposits in a contract nightmare affecting home owners.

title.children: Building giant tells buyers to pay hundreds of thousands extra or lose homes and deposits

image.altText: Two players battle for a football.

items.synopsis: The Matildas can book their place in the Round of 16 with a victory over Nigeria in Brisbane. Follow the match live.

title.children: Win and we're in — Matildas kick-off crucial clash with Nigeria as next round of the World Cup looms

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Hayley Raso comes withing a whisker of scoring for Australia. The ball from a corner hits the head of a Nigerian defender, and lands at Raso's right foot at the far post. It is a little behind her, and she can't manage to get it into the practically open net. A half-chance she wishes she could do over.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 31': Raso wide from the corner

children.content: Hayley Raso comes withing a whisker of scoring for Australia.
The ball from a corner hits the head of a Nigerian defender, and lands at Raso's right foot at the far post.
It is a little behind her, and she can't manage to get it into the practically open net.
A half-chance she wishes she could do over.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Best chance the game so fat goes to the goal scorer for the Matildas against Ireland. Steph Catley fired a rocket at the Nigerian goal, but keeper Chiamaka Nnadozie was up to the task, and knocked it clear.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 13': Steph Catley shot saved

children.content: Best chance the game so fat goes to the goal scorer for the Matildas against Ireland.
Steph Catley fired a rocket at the Nigerian goal, but keeper
Chiamaka Nnadozie was up to the task, and knocked it clear.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Referee Esther Staubli blows the whistle. The Matildas could be 90 minutes away from guaranteeing a berth in the Round of 16.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Kick-off between the Matlidas and Nigeria

children.content: Referee Esther Staubli blows the whistle. The Matildas could be 90 minutes away from
guaranteeing a berth in the Round of 16.

image.altText: A man in a navy suit with a white shirt and light blue tie stands in front of a bookshelf.

items.synopsis: The Victorian opposition is criticising Premier Daniel Andrews for his interactions with a property developer who was the subject of an anti-corruption commission report released on Thursday.

title.children: Andrews government has a 'culture of corruption and secrecy', Victorian opposition says in wake of IBAC report release

image.altText: Bald man in army greens holding a gun in front of white wall.

items.synopsis: One of the top leaders in the Russian Army, Sergei Surovikin, has not been seen since the mutiny against the Kremlin last month. At first it seems odd, but it turns out General Surovikin is not who he seems.

title.children: Russian 'General Armageddon' Sergei Surovikin is missing — is he 'resting' or Resting In Peace?

image.altText: A composite image of Sinead O'Conner and Prince

items.synopsis: Despite being Sinéad O'Connor's most recognisable song, Nothing Compares 2 U originally came from the pen of Prince.

title.children: Nothing Compares 2 U: How the song of 1990 went from Prince to Sinéad and back again

image.altText: Sinead O'connor wearing a priests black outfit with a cross holding a microphone and smiling

items.synopsis: Irish singer-songwriter Sinéad O'Connor, who became a superstar in her mid-20s, dies at 56.

title.children: Sinéad O'Connor, who topped charts in the 90s, dies aged 56

image.altText: A woman wearing a police hat

items.synopsis: Senior NSW Police officers deny losing control of the escalating drug wars across Sydney but admit they are up against a "wall of silence". Five people have been shot in five days — two of them fatally.

title.children: Police deny losing control of drug war as man dies days after Sydney car ambush

image.altText: Woman smiling on airbike

items.synopsis: Incontinence is a health issue affecting one in four Australians, but shame and embarrassment often stop people from seeking help, writes Caitlyn Davey.

title.children: A bladder condition nearly destroyed my kidneys and made me realise we need to talk about incontinence

image.altText: Two Minimocursor phunoiensis, who have pink heads, orange beak-like mouths, long necks and tiny arms

items.synopsis: Researchers say the young creature, which was about the size of a dog, is "one of the best-preserved dinosaurs ever found in South-East Asia".

title.children: New species of dinosaur discovered in Thailand

image.altText: Kirrawee nursing home Joan Hobbs

items.synopsis: The family of Joan Hobbs have called for better staffing after the 89-year-old woman was attacked by a fellow dementia patient with a walking frame.

title.children: Elderly woman allegedly bashed to death by fellow dementia patient in Sydney nursing home

image.altText: Composite image of football fans from the 32 nations competing at the FIFA Women's World Cup

items.synopsis: With the FIFA Women's World Cup in full swing, fans all around Australia show their true colours and share their passion for the world game, and their country.

title.children: Here's what it means to football fans from all over the world to see a Women's World Cup here

image.altText: The back of a man and a woman looking out across a ledge where smoke burns

items.synopsis: As temperatures rise and seas warm experts say there is a lot more to consider when planning your next overseas holiday..

title.children: Popular holiday destinations are paying the price of climate change. Here's how tourists don't have to
